Posts.Content: Hi Otago Have had Psa since age 55 all closer to 1 from memory. Length of cores where Tumour 0.6mm was found were 12/9/7mm. Urologist didnt comment on DRE after he examined me
Posts.Title: Active Surveillance

Posts.Content: Hi Just recieved results of prostate biopsy Psa 2.4 to 4.7 in 12 months Gleason 3+3=6 Stage T2a Tumour 0.6mm long in 1 sample High Grade dysplasia (PIN) in 3 samples No Significant pathologic changes in rest of samples Total 16 cores. Thinking about going with Active Surveillance? Anyone with similar numbers gone that way? Thanks Peter
Posts.Title: Active Surveillance

Posts.Content: Hi Just recieved results of prostate biopsy Psa 2.4 to 4.7 in 12 months Gleason 3+3=6 Stage T2a Tumour 0.6mm long in 1 sample High Grade dysplasia (PIN) in 3 samples No Significant pathologic changes in rest of samples Total 16 cores. Posts.Title: Active Surveillance

Posts.Content: Thanks for response Otago Age 65 Psa Jan 2010 1.8 Jan 20122.4 March 2013 4.7 Doctor felt slightly enlarged prostate but psa velocity triggered the biopsy.June 3013 psa 4.3 Biopsy Sept 2013. Free psa at 4.7 was17. Urologist conclusion-microscopic focus of adenocarcinoma identified in biopsy (d) (the 0.6mm tumor one) Lt base
